text: Exercise 1% Is there a big-step transition for each of the following cases? If so, prove it 1. (x:=2; (skip; y := 3), [r + 3.y 5]) > ? 2. (if x <y thenz := 5 elseS, [r 2,y 3,z + 5])) + ? where S = (if x+1 < y then z := 2 else z := 3) 3. (skip; x := 3; whilex < 5do (x := x+ 1; y := 2), s) + ? where 5 = [z + 2,y â€” 0]
